page.title: 03BUILDINGS
page.content: The buildings in this area are mainly old farms with rooves of pan-tiles or "Double Romans", although there are a few post-war residential buildings scattered throughout the block. To the North-East there are several new bungalows, on the{outskirts of Dundon, which are presumably residences for people working in Street or Glastonbury. {Somerton Door Farm}is typical of the farms in this area in that old farm buildings cluster around the original farmhouse but they have been supplemented by very modern large barns of corrugated iron. In addition a bungalow has recently been built on the farm. At{Park}there are two old farms whose buildings have been supplemented by breeze block constructions and even two rusted-out Missen huts! Decoy Farm to the north is a deserted ruin
